div.p: This value set expansion contains 16 concepts.

td.a: Client's age is less than 9 months-41

tr.td: Client's age is less than 9 months

td.a: Client is not due for first dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV1)-48

tr.td: Client is not due for first dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV1)

td.a: No measles primary series doses were administered-127

tr.td: No measles primary series doses were administered

td.a: Client's age is more than or equal to 9 months-41

tr.td: Client's age is more than or equal to 9 months

td.a: No live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks-92

tr.td: No live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks

td.a: Live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks-92

tr.td: Live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks

td.a: Client is not due for MCV1-48

tr.td: Client is not due for MCV1

td.a: Client's age is less than 15 months-42

tr.td: Client's age is less than 15 months

td.a: Client is not due for second dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV2)-48

tr.td: Client is not due for second dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV2)

td.a: Client's age is more than or equal to 15 months-42

tr.td: Client's age is more than or equal to 15 months

td.a: Client is not due for MCV2-48

tr.td: Client is not due for MCV2

description.value: ValueSet IMMZD2DTMeaslesOngoingTransmission for IMMZ.D2.DT.Measles.Ongoing transmission. Business rule: Determine if the client is due for a measles vaccination according to the national immunization schedule Trigger: IMMZ.D2 Determine required vaccination(s) if any Table: Countries with ongoing transmission in which the risk of measles mortality remains high (countries that provide first dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV) at 9 months and second dose of MCV at 15 months)
